definition[0]: to pull with one or more short, quick pulls
example[0]: The woman gently tugged his arm.
example[1]: Joe was tugging at her sleeve.
definition[1]: to pull a piece of clothing quickly onto your body
example[2]: Alice was tugging on a sweater.
definition[2]: a small strong boat used for pulling or guiding ships into a port, up a river etc
example[3]: She removed the bandage with a sharp tug.
example[4]: Kate felt a tug of jealousy.
